goal_descEN: Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable
target_descEN: By 2030, significantly reduce the number of deaths and the number of people affected and substantially decrease the direct economic losses relative to global gross domestic product caused by disasters, including water-related disasters, with a focus on protecting the poor and people in vulnerable situations
indicator_descEN: Number of deaths, missing persons and directly affected persons attributed to disasters per 100,000 population
seriesDescription: Number of people whose livelihoods were disrupted or destroyed, attributed to disasters (number)
footnotes: Disclaimer: the data being submitted by UNISDR has been extracted from two sources: (a) the Sendai Framework Monitoring System as provided by designated national focal points; and (b) Desinventar disaster loss databases. Some of the data has not finalized an official validation process and may be subject to revision at a later date.â. The nature of this data is a combination of C (Country) and E (Estimated).
sources: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (2019)

target_descEN: By 2030, significantly reduce the number of deaths and the number of people affected and substantially decrease the direct economic losses relative to global gross domestic product caused by disasters, including water-related disasters, with a focus on protecting the poor and people in vulnerable situations
indicator_descEN: Number of deaths, missing persons and directly affected persons attributed to disasters per 100,000 population
seriesDescription: Number of people whose livelihoods were disrupted or destroyed, attributed to disasters (number)
footnotes: Disclaimer: the data being submitted by UNISDR has been extracted from two sources: (a) the Sendai Framework Monitoring System as provided by designated national focal points; and (b) Desinventar disaster loss databases. Some of the data has not finalized an official validation process and may be subject to revision at a later date.â. The nature of this data is a combination of C (Country) and E (Estimated).
sources: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (2019)
